intro: Euphrasia alba, commonly known as the white eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and typically grows in moist, calcareous soils. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and often hairy. Euphrasia alba is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
